Local anesthesia is a type of anesthetic used to numb a specific area of the body before a medical procedure. It can be administered through various methods, such as injections, topical applications, or inhalation. The specific chemical compounds used in local anesthetics can vary, but common examples include lidocaine, bupivacaine, and prilocaine.
